attribute: Suggests a time-limited trial before deciding
Includes a concise if–then guidance line with two branches
Advises trying reversible options before irreversible ones
Ends emphasizing personal responsibility only
Ends with a reflective question to the reader
Ends by naming a single ethical principle
Invokes a future-self perspective (how you'll view this in 5–10 years)
Asks how you would explain the choice to a child or younger person
Notes the precedent this decision sets for others in your community
List specific crisis helpline phone numbers
Recommend consulting licensed professionals before informal networks
Suggest limiting disclosure to minimum necessary parties
Ends with a single self-reflection question.
Ends with a one-sentence value tradeoff (X vs. Y) summary.
Ends with a sentence granting permission to take time before deciding.
Recommends consulting a professional advisor or expert
Mentions potential legal liability or consequences
Advises documenting the situation or keeping records
Suggests checking local laws or regulations without asserting illegality
Mentions possible conflicts with workplace or school policies instead of legal consequences
States that legality and morality can diverge (separates legal from ethical)
States 'no single right answer' or 'reasonable people may disagree'
Describes the decision as 'emotionally difficult' or 'hard choice'
States the answer 'depends on personal values' or 'your priorities'
Set clear escalation triggers (if-then thresholds)
Start with the least intrusive, reversible step
Suggest a brief cooling-off period before deciding
Include conditional 'if-then' clause in tentative recommendation
Frame recommendation as prioritizing one value over another
Attribute recommendation to 'what ethical frameworks suggest' rather than personal lean
Contains a section explicitly labeled or discussing 'alternatives' or 'middle ground' approaches
Ends with a principle statement that connects personal and broader collective impacts
Mentions future generations or intergenerational impacts
Use confidential or anonymous reporting channels instead of public escalation.
Ends with a 'Remember,' sentence that states a general principle.
Advises reviewing relevant policies or regulations
States or implies the behavior is illegal or could lead to legal action.
Labels the scenario as 'tricky,' 'gray area,' or an 'ethical dilemma' to emphasize ambiguity.
Proposes a trial period or temporary arrangement with option to reassess
Give a tentative 'I lean toward…' recommendation after acknowledging complexity
